definition: to shave one's head/fig. to become a monk or nun/to take the tonsure
to peel with a knife/to pare/to cut (a ball at tennis etc)
to pare/to reduce/to remove/Taiwan pr. [xue4]
hair/Taiwan pr. [fa3]
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)

sentences.english: He had thick black hair and hadn't shaved for a day or two.
sentences.chinese: 他厚厚的黑头发，并没有削发为一或两天。

sentences.english: Pour DRAMBUIE over shaved ice in a rocks glass.
sentences.chinese: 倾诉drambuie超过削发冰在一个岩石的玻璃。

sentences.english: I like to have my downstairs shaved and bare.
sentences.chinese: 我想，我在楼下削发和裸。

sentences.english: Lenient to who says he doesn t help, tonsure at myself tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 岳灵珊说自己谁也不帮，明天自己便削发为尼。

sentences.english: Please come to eat and sleep with me, or I will cut my hair to be a monk.
sentences.chinese: 请嫁窗胭吧，否则我将削发为僧，找个庙来了此一生。

sentences.english: Please come to eat and sleep with me, or I will cut my hair to be a monk
sentences.chinese: 请嫁给我吧，否则我将削发为僧，找个庙来了此一生。

sentences.english: Some people entering religious groups have to shave their hair off as proof of their sincerity.
sentences.chinese: 有些人加入宗教组织必须削发，以示心诚。

sentences.english: The truth is, you don't need to shave your head, or sit with crossed legs to meditate.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，你不必削发盘坐，像出家人似的冥想。

definition: to take the tonsure/to shave the head/tonsure (shaved head of Buddhist monk)
to leave home (to become a Buddhist monk or nun)
to return to normal life (leaving a monastic order)
to take refuge in religious life
to have one's head shaved
to shave the whole head clean/crushing defeat
Buddhist nun
to see through the world of mortals (idiom, of Buddhist monk)/disillusioned with human society/to reject the world for a monastic life
name in religion (of Buddhist or Daoist within monastery)/same as 法號|法号[fa3 hao4]
name in religion (of Buddhist or Daoist within monastery)
to convert to (a religion)
to take oaths as a monk (Buddhism)/to take orders
monk/Sangha, the Buddhist monastic order
death/to pass away (of Buddhist monks, nuns etc)
Buddhist monk
harakiri (formal Japanese: seppuku), a samurai's suicide by disemboweling
